$interpreted: Morris: So, as expected, the mission of the Immortals is to resurrect the giant dragon Sdorica?
Morris: Tsk. How original.
Zola: Hehe, uttering such disrespectful words in front of me is fine. But if some of the Halos hear...
Zola: ...just don't say I didn't warn you.
Morris: They're no different than me, using someone else's body to restore their soul, how scary could they be?
Zola: Do not compare yourself, a new Immortal, to the "Eternals". The knowledge they possess of runes far surpasses your imagination.
Morris: Hmph. Anyone can talk a big talk.
Morris: For example?
Zola: ...For example, why would the sect work so hard to open the void?
Morris: So, the explosion in Atlas really was your doing...
Morris: For the dragon's organs?
Zola: Yes...and no.
Zola: Everything that the sect does is to prepare for the resurrection of the dragon.
Zola: Countless scholars of the Rune Academy, have they really discovered the essence of "monsters" after all these years?
Morris: ...Monsters and the resurrection of Sdorica are related!?
Morris: So the inhalation and exhalation of the void——
Zola: You will learn of the details after you formally join the sect.
Zola: Now, hurry up and finish this so-called "extraordinary" experiment. After the aftermath is dealt with, we'll take our leave.
Zola: Follow me.
Morris: ...Hmph.
Aosta: (...Professor...it was the professor who was resurrected...so why do I feel...)
Charle: Tica! Headmaster Balzac!
Charle: Wake up!
Barbara: Ah...
Tica: ...Ugh...my head hurts...
Charle: Is this...the old warehouse?
Charle: Why would he bring us...
Zola: You'd have to ask your good friend~
Zola: I heard it was more convenient for the experiment. Is that correct, Mr. Dietrich?
Morris: ......
Barbara: That stone tablet...was used by Samuel Balzac...
Barbara: My headmaster key, it was taken!
Barbara: You went to the Library of Forbidden Texts!?
Morris: And?
Morris: Woman, you don't trust me and demanded you cast it yourself, isn't that right?
Morris: Then begin.
Zola: ...Hmph. I have no need to obey your commands, but...
Zola: ...this seems interesting.
Charle: This magic circle, it's...!
Morris: Hmph, I taught her that.
Morris: If you wish to use the incomplete Forbidden Rune, this is the simplest method.
Barbara: Damn it...
Barbara: We can't just sit here and wait to die!
Charle: Now! Stop her!
Barbara: Damn!
Morris: Surprised?
Morris: This is why the Academy does not allow the study of the Forbidden Rune.
Morris: Though it's still just a prototype, it can still cause the entire modern rune system to collapse.
Charle: ...Morris, what on earth are you doing?
Morris: Shut up and watch.
Morris: One more night. We watch until morning and make sure they can't break the formation, then they're useless to us.
Tica: Ehhhhhh, so he wants to kill us!?
Charle: Morris! Don't do something stupid!
Morris: ...It was not easy to be resurrected.
Morris: No longer will I allow self-interested old geezers to continue to obstruct a new era of knowledge from emerging.
Morris: ...I didn't expect you to understand, Charle.
Zola: Hehe...not bad.
Zola: That expression of great suffering I saw on Shirley's face, you caused that. Now, I'm returning the favor.
Charle: Wait! Morris! Morris——!

Model.Text: So, as expected, the mission of the Immortals is to resurrect the giant dragon Sdorica?
Tsk. How original.
Hehe, uttering such disrespectful words in front of me is fine. But if some of the Halos hear...
...just don't say I didn't warn you.
They're no different than me, using someone else's body to restore their soul, how scary could they be?
Do not compare yourself, a new Immortal, to the "Eternals". The knowledge they possess of runes far surpasses your imagination.

For example?
...For example, why would the sect work so hard to open the void?
So, the explosion in Atlas really was your doing...
For the dragon's organs?
Yes...and no.
Everything that the sect does is to prepare for the resurrection of the dragon.
Countless scholars of the Rune Academy, have they really discovered the essence of "monsters" after all these years?
...Monsters and the resurrection of Sdorica are related!?
So the inhalation and exhalation of the void——
You will learn of the details after you formally join the sect.
Now, hurry up and finish this so-called "extraordinary" experiment. After the aftermath is dealt with, we'll take our leave.
Follow me.
...Hmph.

My headmaster key, it was taken!
You went to the Library of Forbidden Texts!?
And?
Woman, you don't trust me and demanded you cast it yourself, isn't that right?
Then begin.
...Hmph. I have no need to obey your commands, but...
...this seems interesting.
This magic circle, it's...!
Hmph, I taught her that.
If you wish to use the incomplete Forbidden Rune, this is the simplest method.
Damn it...
We can't just sit here and wait to die!
Now! Stop her!
Damn!
Surprised?
This is why the Academy does not allow the study of the Forbidden Rune.
Though it's still just a prototype, it can still cause the entire modern rune system to collapse.
...Morris, what on earth are you doing?
Shut up and watch.
One more night. We watch until morning and make sure they can't break the formation, then they're useless to us.
Ehhhhhh, so he wants to kill us!?
Morris! Don't do something stupid!
...It was not easy to be resurrected.
No longer will I allow self-interested old geezers to continue to obstruct a new era of knowledge from emerging.
...I didn't expect you to understand, Charle.
Hehe...not bad.
That expression of great suffering I saw on Shirley's face, you caused that. Now, I'm returning the favor.
Wait! Morris! Morris——!
